Vin Diesel proves a reliable leading man, Paul Walker is OK as an undercover cop and the leading ladies (Rodruigez and Brewster) do well too, but you're not gonna see this for the acting or other minor details, you're gonna see it for the action. And there are plenty of smashes, crashes and general carnage to satisfy those hungry for explosions. Which in my eyes, is a good thing. Probably the best action flick of the summer, this rocks, despite the hammy script.

Title: Used up storyline!!
Content: I rented this movie as like most guys my age I like my cars, but even they didn't make up for the fact the acting was so lame and the storyline was (in my opinion),copied from Point Break. Diesel the main character being a rather poor replacment for Bodie in P.B, the head of a gang who steel to fund there car obssesion(surfing in P.B). The plot being a police officer who joins the gang under cover(the same),thinks its a rival gang from the same neighbourhood doing the steeling but is proved wrong(the same),makes a connection with Diesel(Bodie) and finds himself in moral dilema(the same),falls for a girl in the gang and finds it sways his judgment(the same). Now I cant be the only one to think this is too close for comfort can I? All this and a very similar ending where the oportunity to do the right thing arrives and he takes it showing the audience how hes changed. I loved Point Break and couldn't help but find this a weak imitation.

Title: Alright
Content: This movie is a alright movie I mean it has awesome cars, car chases, hot chicks, a good villain, all actors are good, and the story is not that good. This movie if you are looking for a lot of races and chases then this isn't the right movie for you. This movie falls including to the better, but not great sequal 2Fast2Furious. This one has only a few racing scenes there should be way more then there were. ** and a half out of ****.

Title: Speed and Lots of It.
Content: For those who are movie inpaired the whole movie was not about cars the basis of the movie was around cars and nice and fast to.  Chad Lindberg who i am a fan of was awesome as jesse.  Van Disel Nuf said and Paul walker made you drool (just like Chad) The actor and script was great and i loved it thank goodness i didn't see it in theatres because my ears would have been blown out.  It was great,for those who loved this movie you rock for those who don't your opinion not my i just don't share the same one.  Highly Recommended! ~!

Title: It's been done.
Content: Well, it's a pretty slick production, and the cars were kinda neat, but I felt it lacking.  Basically, the races should've been shorter, and the chases should have been more original. The set up of cars chasing a semi was given its ultimate form in The Road Warrior.  That is the ultimate expression of that setup.  Nothing in this movie comes close to the stunt work and energy of the chases in Road Warrior or Mad Max. Now, other movies have done cars chasing a semi, such as Black Dog, but none have been as similiar as Fast and the Furious. You've a guy hanging on the front of the truck, you've got the truck driver using a shotgun, you've even got similar car wrecks. If you sat down and did a shot by shot comparison of Road Warrior versus Fast and the Furious, you'd be amazed at the similarities. Anyway, check out the original Vanishing Point, or White Lightning for some great car action.

Title: Hot cars, Hot guys equals...
Content: No content

Title: I LIVE IN HEMET...
Content: A part in the movie was shot in HEMET ,California ,I remember it was in the newspaper it was going to be Redline ,but I guess they changed it. But I did think it kind of sucked not to be mean or anything it did, I do love Paul Walker in it!

Title: silly
Content: I didn't like this movie because he "racing" in it is nothing more than driving really fast down a straight path and seeing who can hit the nitro button first. I was expecting hairpins, fast turns and intense action, but all I got was a bunch of ghetto teens sitting in fast cars and without doing much steering, push one solitary button every 10 seconds that makes them go turbo before their engines overheat and die. Quite frankly if they were travelling that fast in those type of car, the cars would have tore themselves apart. Vin Diesal sounds like he's talking in slow motion and thus sounds very dumb. Thumbs down.

Title: point break on wheels.....
Content: close your eyes and paul walker sounds just like keaneu reeves, there isn't much difference. otherwise i enjoyed the movie. vin diesel still thinks that he is selling stock to boiler room victims, he still hasn't made the break to being a quality actor. i look forward to seeing more of jordana brewster.

Title: A wolf in sheeps clothing!
Content: The cars were cool , the acting was OK , the stunts were impressive. But ... as i started to watch the film and realised that i had to take my brain out to enjoy it i noticed that the plot and story were a BLATANT rip off of a great film called Point Break which starred Patrick Swayze and Keanu Reeves.There are so many similarities , its unbelievable.For any of you that have seen both films think about it ... and if not , check out Point BreakA rookie undercover cop is sent to infiltrate a gang that is suspected of doing some high profile robbery. The cop befriends a girl (a waitress!!!) to get into the gang. The ringleader however seems to have some personal deathwish and has no regard for his own life. The cop gets a bit too pally with the ringleader and when it comes to the crunch and he has to bust him for his crimes he can't do it. Also , the cop reveals his identity to the girl and she hates him for it.There are some differences granted (at the end) but somebody i'm sure has watched Point Break and thought 'hey , we could remould this and make another film out of it!' ....It's a shame if thats the case. Rob Cohen is a cool director and has done some great stuff in the past ..... but this film was a no-no

Title: Four Skid Marks!!
Content: Wow - where are all the drive-ins this movie should be playing at?? Roger Corman would be very proud of this trashy, enjoyable little film. It somehow works. The standard plot chugs along yet there are little interesting touches scattered throughout that shows some dimension to the characters. Great actions scenes and stunts. Rob Cohen has shot the film beautifully (even though his cameo as the Pizza Hut delivery guy needed direction! Hee hee). Walker as the lead cop is a bit bland, but overall this film works.

Title: breast and the bossoms
Content: two words: chicks and cars. more words: hot chicks and fast cars.this is the movie at it's stupidest level. extremely low and basic.but good.and very enjoyable.what else can you ask from an action movie? it has great angles, cool guys, hot chicks, and magnificent casts.. err... i mean cars...watch it again and again, and you find yourself admiring the director's approach on making movie with such weak plot.perfect all-time action movie!

Title: It was PointBreak all over again.
Content: Ever see Point Break with Keanu Reeves and Patrick Swayze? The Fast and The Furious is the exact same plot, only instead of surfing, this movie has fast cars. Swayze has been replaced with Vin Diesel, and the actor portraying Reeves' role is as close to Keanu as Skeet Ulrich is to Johnny Depp. Everything about this movie was set up just so that it would look "cool" on camera. The dialogue was absolutely dripping with cheese. Example: "I live my life a quarter mile at a time. For those ten seconds, I'm free." If you ever hear anyone say things like that, slap them because they have watched The Fast and The Furious too many times. The final few sequences were okay, the semi trailer chase being the best of the whole movie. See this movie in order to know what an exceptional rip off of Point Break it is. Other than that, avoid it like the plague.

Title: Point break + Gone in 60' - good acting = The Fast and the Furious
Content: Believe me, the equation is 100% right. Go see it if you don't believe me. Sincerely this was a stupid movie, It gets too long and tiresome, it a sort of neverending car videoclip that will only work for car lovers. If you are not one of the kind, avoid it at all costs.3 out of 10 (the cars get all the credit)

Title: Started out slow but then it went into overdrive!
Content: I did not catch this at the theaters. I own like 400 DVD's and I see a great number of movies so I can't catch them all in the theater. I knew that I would probably check this out when it came out on DVD. It looked cool, but not great. My friends told me that this was the coolest movie ever and it was the best that they had ever seen. After viewing it I must say that it wasn't the coolest movie ever, but it was pretty cool. All you have to do is just sit back, relax, and don't think. If you watch this and think a lot you might not enjoy it. The first 30 minutes I did just that, but then I started to get into the movie and just enjoy it. Af first it was a little slow, but then I really got into it and I stayed there. The driving scenes were really great. The stunts were unbelievable! All in all this was a cool movie that I think warrants a viewing if not a purchace. 8.5/10

Title: The Fast and the Hyddeous
Content: For movie go-ers these days there isn't much of a variety to choose from. You have the stupid Julia Roberts love stories, the stupid antics of Jackie Chan who's trying to be a funny Chuck Norris, and then the stupid action flicks with no plot. Every once and awhile you will find a movie that makes you think a little bit about society or whatever its subject happens to be. On the surface Fast and the Furious appears to be a stupid action flick with a retarded plot with awesome actions scenes as its only saving grace. Well, this is mostly true. The plot is bland and doesn't make any sense, a bunch of low down dead beats who appear to have no real jobs who can afford a bunch of crappy foreign cars. I'll take my Chevy K-5 any day thank you very much. But on to business. This movie actually has a deeper meaning than is inherently visible. This movie is actually a reversal of several biblical stories woven into a nice finish at the end. The director of this movie, Rob Colen, and Gary Scott Thomsen, adaptor of the screen story, bothattended King's College at Cambridge and this influence is once again present in this work. While studying at Cambridge both men were entranced by the works of C.S. Lewis and other great classics such as Homer's Odyssey and the bible. This story is not about car racing, love or any other stupid themes like that. What Thomsen and Colen have done here is reverse the outcome of several biblical and mythological stories. One that weighs heavily here is the Tower of Babel. "The shadow of that Hyddeous Strength, Sax Myle and more it is of length." This popular quote from the Welsh poet Sir David Lyndsay from his work entitled Ane Dialog, describes the tower of babel as observed in reference to the Fischer King mythology. The Tower of Babel crumbled from a lack of communication according to the myth. That could just as well happen in this representation of the system, but the undercover cop learns to communicate on a spiritual level with the racers, thus learing the importance for maintaining the honor of the racing world, and protecting the true protaganists at the end of the movie. Colen and Thomsen also appear to have taken elements from Greek mythology in the making of this movie as well. Consider these lines from Homer's Odyssey. "Stand beside me, Athena, fire me with daring, fierce as the day we ripped Troy's glittering crown of towers down....Surely I will stand beside you, not forget you, not when the day arrives for us to do our work..." Doesn't this sound familiar to you from the movie? The conversations held before the night street race, before the big finale. Yes, Colen and Thomsen have not only made references in this film to biblical and mythological works but succeeded in blending them together seamlessly. The only thing they forgot was to include Billy Drago in their brilliant cast of actors. This movie has a deep meaning for today's society, as we crumble due to communication barriers all over the world. But people still can stand side by side with others and accomplish great things. I know, I was in the field as a soldier for many years and can tell you that brotherhood can still run strong in this fading world. If every movie was as inspiring as this one, no one would ever want to leave the theater again. In other words... "Fe astudiodd gerddoriaeth gyda'i dad, oedd yn arweinydd seindorf yn, ac yna ym Mhrifysgol Ial. Ei gyfansoddiadau fe fyddai..."

Title: what a silly film
Content:
The Fast and furious may have been exciting, it may have been fun, but cor blimey it was daft.For starters, the crime. Now they may have used cars, and done it at very very high speeds, but essentially they were nicking a few VCRs, a crime more often associated with bored teenagers. With the amount of time and money the LAPD put into this, you'd think drugs, guns or murder would be involved.The races certainly must have been fun to watch. From A to B, straight line, GO! This kind of racing makes formula one seem almost EXCITING, though not quite. what WOULD have been cool would be to see the cars being hurled round tight corners, handbrake turns, that kinda stuff.And where the hell did they get this cop? The Rehabilitation of Speed Junkies and Former Joy Riders Scheme? If were the LAPD, I wouldn't trust no testosterone fuelled, just out of puberty, wannabe boy racer with not just one, but TWO $10,000 cars.As for the plot (it's there if you look hard), I know it's a cliche for these kind of movies but it was So predictable. And the dialogue wasn't much better - the bit when Jesse was saying grace was so cheesy I couldn't even laugh. For me, the coolest guys in the film were the chinese.
But then again, it WAS exciting, there WERE shiny cars which made lots and lots of BRRRUM noises and went fast. Oh well, I guess I just don't have the right mentality for these kind of films.

Title: leave the brain at home and the losers at the lights
Content: I didn't expect much other from TF&TF than an adrenaline soaked action flick with buckets of loud noises, and thus I was definitely not disappointed."Gone in 60 seconds" might be a suitable film to compare it to-it's a cut above that and has far more excitement,even if it shares the same lack of depth of character development.The driving scenes were superb-especially the first race and the Civics chasing the truck in a Mad Max stylee. The sound effects were also outstanding,with the tuned up engine growls, dump valve hisses and turbo whines captured beautifully.Let's not dwell on the sub "Point Break" plot (he's a crim,no he's a cop,now he's the crim's mate again).It was pretty thin-but as an excuse for more car chases it worked.So overall 7/10 visuals 8/10 sound 10/10 plot 3/10

Title: Worst Movie I've Seen This Year
Content: I do not know where to begin with movie. I can talk for hours over how bad it is, but I don't want to waste time on even doing that. Some of my friends loved it, quoting "its only about fast cars, women, and good action". For a start, the action was pitiful - if anyone said this was even remotely engaging, they have not yet seen a decent car chase flick.I give it 0.5 / 10. The half point going for those so called "fast cars and women"

Title: A Great, Action-Packed, Rockin Movie!!!
Content: The Fast and the Furious was a great movie!!! The movie had a good cast which included Paul Walker (Varsity Blues), Vin Diesel (Saving Private Ryan), Jordana Brewster (The Faculty), and Michelle Rodriguez. This movie had AMAZING special effects and was loaded with action. Rob Cohen directed it brilliantly and Neal H. Moritz produced the movie well. This is a highly recommended movie! If you liked "Gone In Sixty Seconds" (2000), you will love this movie. This movie was great, and if you haven't seen it, see it now, or you are missing out on a lot of action and fun! I give The Fast and the Furious a 10 out of 10!!!!!!!!!  :)

Title: DIRTY MARY CRAZY LARRY it ain't
Content: I should've gotten off on it: the previously undistinguished director, Rob Cohen, stages two of the most amazing action set pieces of recent vintage--a nighttime drag race that approaches "2001" trippiness, and a car-and-truck joust that seems to smash together virtuoso sequences from DUEL and RAIDERS OF THE LOST ARK. And the whole thing seems (deliberately or not) to be suffused with an aura of Roger Corman/AIP down-and-dirtiness. I amused myself trying to think of how it would have been cast in 1973: Jan-Michael Vincent as Paul Walker, and...Robert Blake as Vin Diesel? There's even Ted Levine, giving a fine performance as the requisite drive-in-movie Good Guy Cop in a Bad Suit.So what's not to like? Well, Paul Walker, Vin Diesel, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster, basically. The movie has Gary Busey attitude but a Freddie Prinze, Jr. heart. Though Diesel is a good actor, he seems to have a thought bubble above his head that says, "Hmmm! I seem to be turning into the gen-y Stallone! I think I like it!" Walker tries hard and probably isn't worse than most male ingenues of this sort in the post-Gary Wopat era. But Brewster, a handsome, burnished-skinned, Ali McGraw type, is much too suburban and poshy for the white-trash role of Diesel's waitress sister, and Rodriguez, as Diesel's main squeeze, scrunches her face up into a just-sucked-a-lemon sneer and keeps it locked there for two hours.Where is this era's Robert Mitchum--hell, where is its Michael Madsen? The movie's heart is in the right place, and it's engaging enough, but it needs some guys who seem to have never in their life, not once, touched a bottle with the word "moisturizer" on it.

Title: Cool-ified No Man's Land (1987)
Content: This movie's been called a rip-off from Gone in 60 Seconds. Well I'd add up No Man's Land (1987) to the list; minus the unhappy ending. Same story: undercover cop goes into the biz, gets the thrill of racing. Difference is that this flick looks "cooler" because of the cars, the hard rock, the chicks ... even though this clandestine drag-racing exists, it was pushed to the "way too unreal" world. I doubt any street racer would have his car filled with "Verisign","Verizon" and other propaganda; it would bring even more attention to the cops. Its street racing, not NASCAR.It is mildly entertaining, but there is merely ONE car chase scene in the whole movie (more like a "chase the bike" scene). The dialog's cheesy, the plot's swiss-cheesed (full of holes), and there is no real action (except for the aforementioned scene). There's not even enough racing, for the movie tries to develop the "plot" ... without success.If you are looking for car chase movies, go get No Man's Land (1987), The Driver or Ronin. This isn't that kind of movie.

Title: Love it or hate it.
Content: The story line (which is best described as a 'B' movie version of 'Gone In 60 Seconds') seems to center around a band of thugs who drive Honda Civic coupes to hijack 18-wheelers hauling electronics and a cop investigator who falls in love with one of the hijacker's sisters. Pic will please anyone who thrives on teen hip-hop culture, rice rockets and movement alone. those who are partial to actual dialogue, drama and plot with depth look elsewhere.

Title: Ok.
Content: The Fast and the Furious has got one thing going for it that really sets it a part. It has got some of the best car stunts I've ever seen in the movies. I mean some of the stunts simply blow your mind. This movie besides that didn't impress me all too much, sure it had some very good looking ladies in it and they did a fairly good job acting as well as Ted Levine, Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, and the others did. All in all it wasn't terrible but it wasn't even close to being great. 5.8 *'s out of 10 *'s.

Title: Whats so yucky about it?
Content: I didnt see much wrong about it..there's stereotyping(guys,cars,girls,asians..) but thats fine dude. Its a b grade movie and accept that fact. Some people can stomach it and some cant. Dont try to elevate this to a A-budget movie and then critize it. Its much better than the b grade flicks out there which make you sleepy before the movie's half done. It deserves a 6 or 7 out of 10. My 2 cents....
